meanings.definition: provoke or challenge (someone) with insulting remarks
meanings.sent1: The bully kept taunting the smaller kids during recess.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys taunting her little brother when he gets in trouble.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was taunting the birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds taunted the town with threats of rain but never delivered.
meanings.sent5: The persistent cat kept taunting the dog by swatting at its tail.

meanings.definition: a remark made in order to anger, wound, or provoke someone
meanings.sent1: His taunting caused her to lose her temper and storm out of the room.
meanings.sent2: The taunting from the opposing team only fueled his determination to win.
meanings.sent3: The playful taunting between friends added a fun competitive edge to the game.
meanings.sent4: The taunting of the bullies echoed in his mind long after school was over.
meanings.sent5: The taunting in the movie made the villain seem even more menacing.
